title: MC_MoveLinearRelative (FunctionBlock)
text:
FUNCTION_BLOCK FINAL MC_MoveLinearRelative
This function block commands a linear movement of an axis group
by the specified relative distance in the specified coordinate system.
Note
The velocity/acc-/deceleration/jerk of each axis are properties
of each axis and not specified within this function block.
See also inputs
VelFactor
,
AccFactor
and
JerkFactor
.

rows.Name: AxisGroup
rows.Comment: Reference to a group of axes

rows.Name: Execute
rows.Comment: Start the motion at rising edge

rows: Relative distance in the specified coordinate system

Maximum path velocity [u/s] for the coordinate system in
which the path is defined. Always positive. Not necessarily reached.

Defines the chronological sequence of the FB relative to the
previous block.
Defined the blending in case of a blending buffer mode
Determines how the orientation is interpolated.

The maximum velocity of each axis is multiplied by this factor, which
must be in the range ]0, 1].

The maximum acceleration of each axis is multiplied by this factor, which
must be in the range ]0, 1].

The maximum jerk of each axis is multiplied by this factor, which
must be in the range ]0, 1].

The maximum torque of each axis is multiplied by this factor, which
must be in the range ]0, 1].  A dynamic model must have been set usingSMC_GroupSetDynamicsfor this factor to have an effect.

If an instance ofSMC_MoveAdditionalAxesAbsoluteorSMC_MoveAdditionalAxesRelativeis assigned to this input, the additional axes of the axis group will perform
the specified movement while this function block is active.
Set to0if no additional axes movement has to be performed or if there are no
additional axes.

rows.Name: Done
rows.Comment: Commanded end positions reached for all axes

rows: Indicates that the FB has control on the axis
Command is aborted by another command

The command has been accepted by the axis group.
If the output becomesTRUE, the function block instance can be used to
command the next movement with a new rising edge onExecute.
While the output isFALSE, keep calling the function block without
a new rising edge ofExecute.
The output is reset toFALSEon a falling edge ofExecute.
Signals that an error has occurred within the function block
